skill.name: youtrack
skill.description: Interacts with YouTrack issue tracker for IdeaVim. Use when working with tickets (VIM-XXXX), adding comments, managing tags, setting status, or release management. This project does NOT use GitHub Issues - use YouTrack instead.
skill.summary: Interacts with YouTrack issue tracker for IdeaVim. Use when working with tickets (VIM-XXXX), adding ...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: The directory contains documentation and metadata only. No executable code, scripts, or network-capable logic are present here.

content.value_statement: Tracking VIM tickets is slow when you forget YouTrack commands. This skill gives clear command guidance for comments, tags, status, and releases.
actual_capabilities: Lists commands to add public or private comments to VIM tickets
Lists commands to add or remove tags by tag ID
Lists commands to set ticket status values
Lists commands to get ticket details
Lists commands to set fix versions and manage release versions
limitations: Requires a valid YOUTRACK_TOKEN environment variable
Depends on external CLI scripts not included in this folder
Applies to the IdeaVim YouTrack project and VIM ticket keys
Does not support GitHub Issues workflows

use_cases.title: Update ticket status
use_cases.description: Move VIM tickets to Ready To Release after verification.

use_cases.title: Manage release versions
use_cases.description: Create or delete YouTrack versions for IdeaVim releases.

use_cases.title: Post review comments
use_cases.description: Add public or private comments requesting review on VIM tickets.

prompt_templates.title: Add a public comment
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a public comment to VIM-1234 that says the issue reproduces in 2.28.0.

prompt_templates.title: Tag a ticket
prompt_templates.prompt: Add the claude-analyzed tag to VIM-1234 and confirm the tag ID used.

prompt_templates.title: Set ticket status
prompt_templates.prompt: Set the status of VIM-1234 to Ready To Release.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare a release
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a YouTrack version 2.29.0 and set VIM-1234 fix version to 2.29.0.

output_examples.input: Add a private comment to VIM-1234 asking Aleksei.Plate for clarification.
output: Use the add-comment command with the --private flag
Mention Aleksei.Plate in the comment text

best_practices: Confirm the VIM ticket key before running a command
Use private comments for internal requests
Reuse documented tag IDs to avoid mistakes
anti_patterns: Using GitHub Issues commands for IdeaVim tickets
Posting sensitive details in public comments

faq.question: Is this compatible with all YouTrack projects?
faq.answer: It is documented for the IdeaVim YouTrack project and VIM ticket keys only.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: You need a valid YOUTRACK_TOKEN and the external CLI scripts available.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my local scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, you can call the listed CLI commands from your own scripts.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, this folder contains documentation only and does not execute code.

faq.question: What if a command fails?
faq.answer: Check the token, ticket key, and YouTrack permissions, then retry.

faq.question: How does it compare to GitHub Issues tools?
faq.answer: It targets YouTrack only and does not support GitHub Issues workflows.
